https://so01.tci-thaijo.org/index.php/abcjournal/article/view/241197
google translate: Research Journal for Spatial Development would like to withdraw the article on Artistic Tourism Routes in Wiang District Chiang Saen District Chiang Rai Province. There were 1) the authors used the research results in the same set of data from the research project. To be republished in both journals 2) Plagiarism was found in abstracts, texts and paragraphs in 2 journals

a.span: A Daily Dose of Humanities

br.span: (HSC) Medicine - General; (HUM) Arts - General; (SOC) Education;

span.span: Journal of Graduate Medical Education ---
Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education

span.style: border-top-style: solid; border-top-width: 2px;

br.span: Providence Internal Medicine Residency , Spokane
University of Washington School of Medicine

img.title:
https://www.jgme.org/doi/10.4300/JGME-D-19-00265.1
“A Daily Dose of Humanities” by Potyk D, Swanson J, Benson J, Journal of Graduate Medical Education.
The above article has been retracted by agreement between the Journal of Graduate Medical Education (JGME) Editor-in-Chief, Gail M. Sullivan, MD, MPH, and the JGME.
The reason for the retraction is the authors' concerns regarding the handling of the survey data presented in this New Idea article.
Reference 1. Potyk D, Swanson J, Benson J. A daily dose of humanities. J Grad Med Educ. 2018;10(3):341–342. doi:https://doi.org/10.4300/JGME-D-17-00910.1. [Abstract] [Google Scholar]

a.span: An Analysis of Japanese Newspaper Reporting on the Rio Paralympic Games: Focusing on Photographs and the Sections in which they were

br.span: (HUM) Arts - General; (SOC) Communications;

span.span: Journal of the Paralympic Research Group ---
The Nippon Foundation Paralympic Support Center

span.style: border-top-style: solid; border-top-width: 2px;

br.span: The Nippon Foundation Paralympic Support Center

img.title:
lemonstoism http://para.tokyo/english/2019/03/notice-of-research-paper-retraction-and-apology.html
We regret to inform you of the retraction of papers by a former researcher at the Nippon Foundation Paralympic Support Center's Paralympic Research Group published in the journal of Vol.11. Falsified information in a paper submitted to the journal of Vol.11 by the researcher has come to light, and papers by the same researcher that have already been published in the journal were closely reexamined. The decision to retract the papers was made on the grounds of the following misconduct.
Journal: Journal of the Paralympic Research Group Author: Shohei Kobayashi
1. Vol.7(published in April 2017, pp. 41-51) Title: An Analysis of Japanese Newspaper Reporting on the Rio Paralympic Games: Focusing on Photographs and the Sections in which they were Published Grounds for retraction: The paper was found to have falsified data.
2. Vol.10(published in September 2018, pp. 85-114) Title: A Trend and Educational Effect of Paralympic Education in Japan - A Case Study of IPC -Accredited Teaching Tool I'mPOSSIBLE - Grounds for retraction: It was discovered that a survey published in the paper hadnot been conducted, and therefore that the data of the survey was fabricated. Please note that the co-author of the paper Kei Hiraga only wrote Appendix 1 (pp.105-109) of the paper, and had no involvement in the fabricated survey.
Further to the confirmation of the above misconduct, the Nippon Foundation Paralympic Support Center has terminated their service agreement with the researcher. We apologize sincerely for any inconvenience caused by the misconduct and our decision to retract the papers.Taking the misconduct seriously, we are determined to take every measure to further strengthen the internal monitoring system and prevent reoccurrences of similar acts through high ethical standards. We appreciate your continued support and thank you for your kind understanding on this matter.
The Nippon Foundation Paralympic Support Center President Kazuo Ogoura
????????? | ???? | ??????????

a.span: Administrative Duplicate Publication The effects of windblown sand on the deterioration of mural paintings in cave 285, in Mogao caves, Dunhuang

br.span: (ENV) Environmental Sciences; (HUM) Arts - General;

span.span: Journal of Building Physics ---
SAGE Publications

span.style: border-top-style: solid; border-top-width: 2px;

br.span: Research and Development Center, Daiken Corporation, Tokyo, Japan
Kyoto University, Kyoto, Japan
Department of Architecture and Architectural Engineering, Kyoto University, Kyoto, Japan
Tokyo National Research Institute for Cultural Properties, Tokyo, Japan
Dunhuang Academy, Gansu, China

img.title:
https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/full/10.1177/1744259118822352
Withdrawal - Administrative Duplicate Publication of “The effects of windblown sand on the deterioration of mural paintings in cave 285, in Mogao caves, Dunhuang”
Mikayama A, Hokoi S, Ogura D, Okada K and Su B. The effects of windblown sand on the deterioration of mural paintings in cave 285, in Mogao caves, Dunhuang. Journal of Building Physics. First Published June 26, 2018.
Ahead of Print article withdrawn by publisher.
Due to an error caused by the publisher, this article was accidentally published twice Online First with different DOIs.
The correct and citable version of the article remains:
Mikayama A, Hokoi S, Ogura D, Okada K and Su B. The effects of windblown sand on the deterioration of mural paintings in cave 285, in Mogao caves, Dunhuang. Journal of Building Physics. First Published June 26, 2018. DOI: 10.1177/1744259118782540.

a.span: The princess of polka dots: Using art as a medium to cope with hallucinations

br.span: (HUM) Arts - General; (SOC) Psychology;

span.span: Indian Journal of Psychiatry ---
Wolters Kluwer

span.style: border-top-style: solid; border-top-width: 2px;

br.span: Department of Psychiatry, JSS Medical College and Hospital, JSS Academy of Higher Education and Research, Formerly JSS University, Mysore, Karnataka, India

img.title:
rolf http://www.indianjpsychiatry.org/article.asp?issn=0019-5545;year=2019;volume=61;issue=1;spage=112;epage=112;aulast=
The letter to editor titled “The princess of polka dots: Using art as a medium to cope with hallucinations” published in Indian Journal of Psychiatry, on pages 156-158, Issue 1, Volume 60, 2018,[1] is being retracted due to copyright concerns of the images used by the author in the article. This has been brought to notice of the Editor-in-Chief by one of the copyright holder of the images of this article. Plagiarism, unethical publication or redundant publication violates the editorial policy of Indian Journal of Psychiatry, which follows best practice guidelines given by the International Committee of Medical Journal Editors (ICMJE) and Committee on Publication Ethics (COPE) mentioned on the Information for Authors and as codified in the signed statements made by the authors regarding the copyright of their work. This letter to editor has been retracted as per request made by one of the contributors, Editor-in-Chief and Editorial Board of the journal.
Editor-in-Chief:
Indian Journal of Psychiatry

a.span: Photophysics of artist’s pigments

br.span: (HUM) Arts - General; (PHY) Chemistry; (PHY) Crystallography/Spectroscopy;

span.span: Measurement ---
Elsevier

span.style: border-top-style: solid; border-top-width: 2px;

br.span: CNR NANOTEC - Institute of Nanotechnology c/o Campus Ecotekne, Via Monteroni, 73100 Lecce, Italy
The Courtauld Institute of Art, Somerset House, Strand, WC2R 0RN London, UK
Dipartimento di Chimica “G.Ciamician”, Università di Bologna, Via F. Selmi 2, 40126 Bologna, Italy
Department of Scientific Research, The British Museum, Great Russell Street, London WC1B 3DG, UK

img.title: retraction notice published well after article retracted

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0263224119302544
This article has been retracted at the request of the Editor-in-Chief and a panel of Measurement Editors due to similarities with three previously-published articles in other journals. The similarities were deemed to constitute duplicate publication on the part of the authors.
The three previously published papers are as follows:
Accorsi, G., Verri, G., Bolognesi, M., Armaroli, N., Clementi, C., Miliani, C., and Romani, A. The exceptional near-infrared luminescence properties of cuprorivaite (Egyptian blue). Chemical Communications 23 (2009), pp. 3392–3394.
Martin de Fonjaudran, C., Acocella, A., Accorsi, G., Tamburini, D., Verri, G., Rava, A., Whittaker, S., Zerbetto, F., and Saunders, D. Optical and theoretical investigation of Indian yellow (euxanthic acid and euxanthone). Dyes and Pigments 144 (2017), pp. 234–241.
Accorsi, G., Verri, G., Acocella, A., Zerbetto, F., Lerario, G., Gigli, G., Saunders, D., and Billinge, R. Imaging, photophysical properties and DFT calculations of manganese blue (barium manganate(vi) sulphate) – a modern pigment. Chemical Communications, 50 (2014), pp. 15297–15300.
The journal’s editorial team apologises for having overlooked these similarities at submission stage.

span.span: 2009 IEEE 10th International Conference on Computer-Aided Industrial Design & Conceptual Design ---
Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)

img.title:
https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/5374938/
After careful and considered review of the content of this paper by a duly constituted expert committee, this paper has been found to be in violation of IEEE's Publication Principles.
We hereby retract the content of this paper. Reasonable effort should be made to remove all past references to this paper.
The presenting author of this paper has the option to appeal this decision by contacting TPII@ieee.org.
The Chu art forms are the materialization of the Chu people's spiritual images. Chu artifacts, which are characterized by the mysterious imagination, romantic style and rich color, reflect the Chu people's spiritual world. The research into the spiritual modes of the Chu people cannot be carried out without investigating the Chu-unique sorcery, polytheism, Taoism and Sao because they are the basic elements that constitute the Chu people's spiritual culture. It is these basic elements that contributed to the formation of the primitive romantic style of Chu art.

a.span: The development and innovation of Qing Dynasty furniture carving art
